conclusion: Analyze the projectile motion to determine the height H at which the projectile hits the high-rise building.
Initial velocity v0 is 50 m/s at an angle θ = 53°.
Horizontal component of velocity v0x = v0 cos θ = 50 cos 53° = 30 m/s.
Vertical component of velocity v0y = v0 sin θ = 50 sin 53° = 40 m/s.
Horizontal distance L to the building is 60 m.
Time t to travel the horizontal distance is t = L / v0x = 60 / 30 = 2 s.
Vertical position y at time t is y = v0y * t - (1/2) * g * t^2 = 80 - 20 = 60 m.
Height H above the ground at which the projectile hits the high-rise building is 60 m.
